elementMetadata.description:
The Zoom API allows developers to safely and securely access information from Zoom. You can use this API to build private services or public applications on the Zoom App Marketplace.

Zoom allows for two types of apps: user-managed and account-level. Endpoints in the Zoom element require an authenticated instance for one or the other. For example, if you want to request the GET /contacts endpoint, you need to have a user-managed authenticated instance, otherwise you will not be able to make the request. If you want to GET /users, you need to have an account-level authenticated instance with admin scopes, or you will not be able to make the request.
elementMetadata.name: Zoom

configuration.description: The maximum number of records the API provider returns in a response
configuration.name: Max Page Size (or limit)

configuration.name: Event Notification Basic User Name

configuration.description: Generic map used to specify default fields for bulk download and GET /all requests. Each key should be the canonical objectName and values may be specified as a comma-delimited string or a list of strings
configuration.name: Default select fields

configuration.description: Used to enable/disable filtering of null values from the responses
configuration.name: Filter null values from the response

configuration.description: Zoom Time of Getting Token or Performing Authentication
configuration.name: Time of Getting Token or Performing Authentication

configuration.description: Zoom Set time interval for polling application (in minutes)
configuration.name: Event poller refresh interval

configuration.description: Zoom This helps find all instances pertaining to an incoming event. The EVENT_NOTIFICATION_INSTANCE_FINDER is composed of two values, in the form "[INSTANCE_CONFIG_PROPERTY_KEY]|[JSON_PATH_TO_PROPERTY_VALUE]". The first value, INSTANCE_CONFIG_PROPERTY_KEY, is the element config key that we will use to determine which instances this event pertains to.  The second value, JSON_PATH_TO_PROPERTY_VALUE, is the JSON XPath to the event JSON that we will use to lookup the instances.  For example, GitHub sends the organization name back in their response, and we save this element config value as "github.organization", so the instance finder for GitHub would be "github.organization|organization.login"
configuration.name: Event Notification Instance Finder

description:
The Zoom API allows developers to safely and securely access information from Zoom. You can use this API to build private services or public applications on the Zoom App Marketplace.

Zoom allows for two types of apps: user-managed and account-level. Endpoints in the Zoom element require an authenticated instance for one or the other. For example, if you want to request the GET /contacts endpoint, you need to have a user-managed authenticated instance, otherwise you will not be able to make the request. If you want to GET /users, you need to have an account-level authenticated instance with admin scopes, or you will not be able to make the request.

resources.description: List all the contacts of a Zoom user. Authenticated Instance must be logged in with user managed access scopes: chat_contact:read. Only available with user-managed apps.

parameters.description: The CEQL search expression
parameters.name: where

parameters.description: The next page token.
parameters.name: nextPage

parameters.description: The number of resources to return in a single request. Default is 30, max is 300.
parameters.name: pageSize

parameters.description: The type, either external or company. Default is company.
parameters.name: type

resources.description: A user under an organization’s Zoom account has internal users listed under Company Contacts in the Zoom Client. Use this request to search users that are in the company contacts of a Zoom account. Admin scope required.

parameters.description: Set the query presence status to true in order to include the presence status of a contact in the response.
parameters.name: presenceStatus

parameters.description: The next page cursor, taken from the response header: elements-next-page-token.
parameters.name: nextPage

parameters.description: Provide either first name, last name or the email address of the user that you would like to search for.
parameters.name: searchKey

parameters.description: The number of resources to return in a given page
parameters.name: pageSize

parameters.description: The CEQL search expression
parameters.name: where

parameters.description: Include this parameter with a value of true to get the presence status of the contact in the response.
parameters.name: presenceStatus

parameters.description: The contact id.
parameters.name: id

parameters.description: Meeting occurrence id.

parameters.description: The Zoom meeting id. Do not use the uuid.

parameters.description: The meeting id. Do not use the uuid.

parameters.name: body

parameters.name: id

parameters.description: Meeting occurrence id.

resources.description: A host or a user with admin permission can require registration for a Zoom meeting. Use this request to list users that have registered for a meeting.

title.x-samplevalue: Did you enjoy the registration process?

parameters.description: The meeting id. Do not use the uuid.
parameters.name: id

parameters.description: The registrant's status: pending, approved, denied. Default is approved.
parameters.name: status

parameters.description: The number of resources to return in a single request. Default is 30, max is 300.
parameters.name: pageSize

parameters.description: The meeting occurrence id.
parameters.name: occurenceId

parameters.description: The page number of the current page in the returned records.
parameters.name: page

resources.description: Register a participant for a meeting. Host user type must be “Licensed”. Requires admin scope. Host user type must be “Licensed”.

parameters.description: The body. See Request Model example and find more information from the vendor's docs here: https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/api-reference/zoom-api/meetings/meetingregistrantcreate .
parameters.name: body

parameters.description: The Zoom meeting id. Do not use the uuid.
parameters.name: id

parameters.description: The meeting occurrence ids. Multiple values separated by a comma.
parameters.name: occurenceIds

resources.description: A Zoom account can have one or more users. Use this request to list users on your account. Only returns confirmed users. Requires admin scope.

parameters.description: The CEQL search expression.
parameters.name: where

parameters.description: Provide a value for this field if you would like to see the following attribute in the response: custom_attributes (returns custom attributes that are associated with the user).
parameters.name: includeFields

parameters.description: Provide if you want to filter results by a specific role.
parameters.name: roleId

parameters.description: The status of the user. Allowed values: active, inactive, pending. Default is active.
parameters.name: status

parameters.description: The number of resources to return in a given page
parameters.name: pageSize

parameters.description: The page number of resources to retrieve
parameters.name: page

resources.description: A Zoom account can have one or more users. Use this request to add a new user to your account. Requires Pro plan or higher and admin scope.

parameters.description: The body. See Request Model example and find more information from the vendor’s docs here: https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/api-reference/zoom-api/users/usercreate
parameters.name: body

resources.description: Deleting a user permanently removes them and their data from Zoom. Deleting a user permanently removes them and their data from Zoom. They will be able to create a new Zoom account with the same email address if they have access to it. By default, this request disassociates (unlinks) a user from the associated account. The disassociation will give them their own basic, free Zoom account. It will not be associated with your account, and they will be able to purchase their own licenses. Requires admin scope.

parameters.description: The action to take, either disassociate a user or delete a user permanently. Allowed values: disassociate, delete.
parameters.name: action

parameters.description: true will transfer meetings.
parameters.name: transferMeeting

parameters.description: true will transfer recordings.
parameters.name: transferRecording

parameters.description: true will transfer webinars.
parameters.name: transferWebinar

parameters.description: The email to transfer current user's data (meetings, webinars and cloud recordings) to. Setting an email sets this value to true automatically. Leave blank to not transfer.
parameters.name: whereTransferEmail

parameters.description: The id of the Zoom user.
parameters.name: id

resources.description: A Zoom account can have one or more users. Use this request to view information of a specific user on a Zoom account. If user-managed/level, pass in "me" into the userId field. Otherwise, requires Admin level scope.

parameters.description: The user id or email address of the of the user. For user-level apps, pass me as the userId.
parameters.name: id

parameters.description: Allowed values: 0,1,99,100,101. Key: 0 -Facebook, 1 -Google, 99 -API, 100 -Zoom, 101 -SSO.
parameters.name: loginType

resources.description: Update information on a user’s Zoom profile. Admin level scope required.

parameters.description: The object body for the user you want to update. See Zoom docs for more information: https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/api-reference/zoom-api/users/userupdate .
parameters.name: body

parameters.description: The id of the Zoom user to update.
parameters.name: id

resources.description: List all the meetings that were scheduled for a user (meeting host). This request only supports scheduled meetings and thus, details on instant meetings are not returned via this request. Admin scope required.

parameters.description: Specify the meeting type. Allowed values: past (meetings that occurred in the specified time range), pastOne (past meetings that were attended by only one user), live (live meetings). Default is live.
parameters.name: type

parameters.description: The page number of the current page in the returned records.
parameters.name: page

parameters.description: The Zoom user id to list meetings for.
parameters.name: id

parameters.description: The number of resources to return in a single request. Default is 30, max is 300.
parameters.name: pageSize

resources.description: Create a meeting for a user. This request has a daily rate limit of 100 requests per day. Therefore, only 100 Create a Meeting requests are permitted within a 24 hour window for a single user. Requires admin scope.

agenda.x-samplevalue: We want to make an element.

parameters.description: The Zoom user id.
parameters.name: id

parameters.description: The body. See Request Model for an example. See https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/api-reference/zoom-api/meetings/meetingcreate for more information/required values.
parameters.name: body

name: Zoom

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: The OAuth header needs to be passed in as follows: The string "Basic" with your Client ID and Client Secret with a colon : in between, Base64 Encoded. For example, Client_ID:Client_Secret  is Q2xpZW50X0lEOkNsaWVudF9TZWNyZXQ=.
